abstract.original_text: Health-care-associated infections are a common cause of increased morbidity, mortality, and cost of care in ICUs. A systematic and multidisciplinary approach to infection control practice goes a long way in minimizing this problem. Infectious patients needs to be isolated to prevent spread of infection to other patients and to healthcare staff. Apart from appropriate isolation precautions, infection control and judicious antibiotic use are the mainstay of management of these patients.
